Uses of Interface
org.ensor.algorithms.control.pid.ISensor

  • Packages that use ISensor 
    Package Description
    org.ensor.algorithms.control.pid
    This package contains an implementation of a PID controller.
    org.ensor.robots.differentialdrive
    This package contains the simulation code required to control a robot to follow a particular path laid out by the navigation system.

    • Uses of ISensor in org.ensor.algorithms.control.pid

      Constructors in org.ensor.algorithms.control.pid with parameters of type ISensor 
      Constructor and Description
      PIDController(ISensor aSensor, IServo aController, double aKp, double aKi, double aKd)
      The constructor creates a new PID controller based on the given measurement sensor, the given control output, and the given PID coefficients.
      PIDController(ISensor aSensor, IServo aController, double aKp, double aKi, double aKd, double aMinOutput, double aMaxOutput)
      The constructor creates a new PID controller based on the given measurement sensor, the given control output, and the given PID coefficients.

    • Uses of ISensor in org.ensor.robots.differentialdrive

      Methods in org.ensor.robots.differentialdrive that return ISensor 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ISensor Odometry.getAngleSensor()
      This method returns a sensor which can return the current angle based on the odometry calculations.
      Constructors in org.ensor.robots.differentialdrive with parameters of type ISensor 
      Constructor and Description
      Odometry(Model aDifferentialDriveModel, ISensor aLeftSpeedSensor, ISensor aRightSpeedSensor)
      This constructor initializes an odometry calculator capable of estimating position based on the input readings of a pair of odometers and a differential drive wheel model.
